[[=]]
+ Waiting Room
[[image https://i.imgur.com/pdYHIPK.png]]

The room is small, covered with peeling black wallpaper. Strange fungi in unnatural neon hues grow underneath and over it: One smaller magenta mold-like fungus and another larger antler-shaped lime green variety. The walls are covered in bookshelves and framed pieces of art. Nice, but... clearly printed on computer paper and hung in dollar store frames.

You're completely alone. But C. Ignota has left you a note on a coffee table nearly covered in patches of green fungi.

> Feel free to enjoy my artwork while you wait. If you want to see more, here is my website for links.
> [http://www.ironshears.com You can find that here.]
> I'll be in in a bit. Just try not to breathe in any spores.

Good thing you're wearing a mask.

[[collapsible show="+SCP-135 by Pig_catapult" hide="Life, in the form of a child."]]
[[image https://i.imgur.com/TuDgi6k.png]]
++ [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-135 SCP-135]
[[<]]
> **Filename:** SCP-135.png
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://imgur.com/a/KWXSxEP
> **Derivative of:** SCP-135 by Pig_catapult
[[/<]]
-----
I finished this about a year and a half ago and I'm still very very proud of it! It's one of my favorite pieces of all time. I loved drawing all of the little mushrooms and plants and bones.

SCP-135 has always been one of my favorites since I read it way back when and I still think about it quite a lot. Something about it is just haunting, I guess.

When I can hold a pen again I'm going to draw more plants.
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="+SCP-5584 by IronShears" hide="OKAY FINE I DREW ART OF MY OWN SCP. WHAT ARE YOU GONNA DO ABOUT IT?"]]
[[image https://i.imgur.com/gd0TsMT.png]]
 ++ [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-5584 SCP-5584]
[[<]]
> **Filename:** brÃ³nach.png
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://imgur.com/a/iDD2lIW
> **Derivative of:** SCP-5584 by IronShears
[[/<]]
-----
This is some promo art for my first SCP! I couldn't do very much before my hand started hurting too bad so it's still a sketch but I think it works anyways!

I wanted to kinda have an ambiguous thing on whether she was writing "Hello" or "Help" but I kinda wrote the L crooked. By the time I realized my hand hurt too much to fix it. But after I showing my friends, I immediately received this.
> "personality test: is she writing the L in "help" or the Y in 'hey'" [[*user paperbackstab]]
So I'm going to pretend it was intentional.

I hope the fact that I... drew my own SCP ONE TIME. I hope that isn't too much of a deterrent from viewing the rest of my art.
[[/collapsible]]

++ Isometric Pixel Art
Click on the TikTok links to watch the videos! I definitely want to do more of these so feel free to suggest some. I want to mostly do Series 6 and 7 or recent re-writes. Newish ones that don't get much love, you know? I will throw in a few older ones if TikTok suggests them though, lol.
[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:happy-halloween2022 HalloweenCon2022 Interactable]
[[collapsible show="+SCP-5584 by IronShears" hide="Uh. I made.... t.... two..."]]
[[image https://i.imgur.com/AQKSftE.gif]]
++++ [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7001187780000795909?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Loop Video] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-5584 SCP-5584]
[[<]]

> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7001187780000795909
> **Derivative of:** SCP-5584 by IronShears
[[/<]]
-----
Okay, two times. Two arts of my own SCP. But hold on hold on hold on! This one's a //video//!!! That's gotta be worth something, right? Click on the gif! It's a link to the video! Go ahead!
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="+SCP-6420 by fairydoctor" hide="Something is not right with these rabbits"]]
[[image https://i.imgur.com/JqaCAYn.gif]]
++++ [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7001561938585029893?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Loop Video] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-5584 SCP-5584] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6420 SCP-6420]
[[<]]
> **Filename:** 6420loop.mp4, 6420.gif
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7001561938585029893
> **Derivative of:** SCP-6420 by fairydoctor
[[/<]]
-----
This one turned out really nice! I'm very proud of the fact you can't really tell the snow is looping.

SCP-6420 is very weird in terrifying ways. Definitely one of those that you don't realize you started thinking about until you catch yourself making that face angry chihuahuas make. But like, in a disgusting way? Yeah.

Reminds me a lot of Sacculina, a parasitic barnacle that does something similar and also elicits that emotion. "Fiction that reminds me of real-life biology fact" is a very quick way to make me like something.
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="+SCP-5851 by Tropinano" hide="Y/N LOOK OUT HE'S GOT A GUN"]]
[[image https://i.imgur.com/CpfOjap.gif]]
++++ [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7003068634285296902?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Loop Video] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-5851 SCP-5851]
[[<]]
> **Filename:** 5851loop.mp4, 5851.gif
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7003068634285296902
> **Derivative of:** SCP-5851 by Tropinano
[[/<]]
-----
I REALLY like the colors on this one! The red was going to be just a placeholder but I really liked the rose-colored glasses fall look that it was giving. I am super proud of this one.

SCP-5851 is weird in a very fun way. Reminds me of fanfics I was terrified of people knowing I read in middle school. Telling kids they are 'cringe' for enjoying cringe things is a plague on this society. They're children. Let them have their age-appropriate harmless fun. 

Kids making goofy art is a part of growing up. I am fighting and losing the urge to show everyone what is quite possibly the best piece of art I've ever created in my entire life. [https://imgur.com/a/D284c09 And I lost]... So that's in the public domain now.
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="+SCP-6032 by Marcelles_Raynes" hide="Radiohead reference????"]]
[[image https://i.imgur.com/gTMiuIH.gif]]
++++ [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7007586394667289862?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Explaination Video] | [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7008631029602716933?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Loop Video] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6032 SCP-6032]
[[<]]
> **Filename:** 6032loop.mp4, 6032.gif
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7008631029602716933?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1
> **Derivative of:** SCP-6032 by Marcelles_Raynes
> **Explaination Video**: https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7007586394667289862?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1
[[/<]]
-----
Is struggled a lot with the colors on this one... but I like how it turned out anyway! The animation was a lot more involved in this one than my pieces normally are too so this one took me a lot longer than most.

My internet was down for 71 hours and I had to go to a cafÃ© to download the webpage so I could actually read it in full for reference. So I was still sitting there at home with the raw early-internet-looking webpage with no theme. And yet, I still really liked it, lol.

6032 is wild; I'm always a sucker for big eldritch horrors. There's a lot of very fun imagery in there, too. And some puns. I don't really know what else to say about it without completely spoiling it so I'm gonna leave it there and say y'all should read it :)


[[/collapsible]]


[[collapsible show="+SCP-6556 by Dysadron and Pedagon" hide="This T-rex is unreasonably silly"]]
[[image https://i.imgur.com/Q8ubZ9o.gif]]
++++ [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7010505844416695557?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Process Video] | [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7010506069139049734?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Loop Video] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:art-mycotherapy-6556-pix Artwork Page] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6556 SCP-6556]
[[<]]
> **Filename:** 6556loop.mp4, 6556.gif
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7010506069139049734?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1
> **Derivative of:** SCP-6556 by Dysadron and Pedagon
[[/<]]
-----
I went a little wild with the color theory on this one but I'm so happy with how it turned out. I also did a biiiiit more of an involved animation than usual because I really got into it. Jeez I'm gonna have to start picking out fun palettes ahead of time it was a lot easier. I know it was an omelet but a fried egg read better in pixel art ð­

I'm normally more of a Paleozoic person than a Mesozoic one but oh boy do I love this SCP. Ty Rex is so silly and I love the whole vibe of it. The room full of enthusiastic scientists not listening to the voice of reason was extremely enjoyable.

I wanted to make absolutely certain I was drawing the juvenile T-Rex accurately(Well, as accurately as I could in the style) so I referenced a bunch of photos of that one very complete fossil of a juvenile and was kinda surprised how raptor-like their faces were! In 20 years after more research is done this is still going to be obviously inaccurate though. Thus is the cycle of paleontology.


[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="+SCP-4966 by Deadly Bread" hide="cute."]]
[[image https://i.imgur.com/HCGAi7H.gif]]
++++ [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7011387585700433158?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Process Video] | [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7011621082146884870?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Loop Video] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:art-mycotherapy-4966-pix Artwork Page] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-4966 SCP-4966]
[[<]]
> **Filename:** 4966loop.mp4, 4966.gif
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7011621082146884870?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1
> **Derivative of:** SCP-4966 by Deadly Bread
[[/<]]
-----
Since the last one was so fun I have decided I am only doing dramatic color palettes now. So far so good! I did struggle a bit at the beginning with making everything actually... look okay. Especially with the limited color palette and the plushies popping out of the background enough. But I think it's good enough! I did have a bit of trouble finding stuff to animate here that I could actually do without causing a flare-up in my wrist so the animation on this one is pretty minimal.

SCP-4966 is definitely cheesy sugarwater and I mean that in the best possible way. It has the same vibe those old animations kids on youtube would make of like warrior cats or valve games or whatever back before youtube animation stopped being made in MSPaint. I'm a sentimental bitch and that kind of goofy fun always makes me smile and reminds me of my childhood. I can definitely see it being too goofy and not being everyone's cup of tea but... I like that kind of thing.
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="+SCP-6096 by Tanhony" hide="What do we do now? Nothing."]]
[[image https://i.imgur.com/lXeEBch.gif]]
++++ [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7012467194973981957?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7012467194973981957?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Process Video] | [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7012469052501232902?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Loop Video] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:art-mycotherapy-6096-pix Artwork Page] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6096 SCP-6096]
[[<]]
> **Filename:** 6096loop.mp4, 6096.gif
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7012469052501232902?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1
> **Derivative of:** SCP-6096 by Tanhony
[[/<]]
-----
I really like the colors on this one. Kind of an eerie ghostly mood. Plus I got to learn how to use gradient maps! Ahhh... It's kind of spooky but not overly oppressive.

SCP-6096 has a really really fun vibe. It's scary but not in an outward way. It's hopeless in a sort of peaceful kind of way. Relatively speaking this anomaly isn't really that dangerous or frightening. It kills people, sure, but compared to other SCPs? It's not that much of a threat

But you can't stop it.
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="+TATTLETALE by JakdragonX" hide="why is the blood blurry?"]]
[[=]]
[[f<image https://i.imgur.com/cGSRahr.gif]]
[[f>image https://i.imgur.com/J15Da9D.gif]]
++++ [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7026447357516549382?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Process Video] | [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7026452245428440325?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Loop Video] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:art-mycotherapy-2774-pix Artwork Page] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-2477 TATTLETALE]
[[<]]
> **Filename:** 2744loop.mp4, 2744.gif
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7026452245428440325?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1
> **Derivative of:** SCP-2744 by Jakdragonx

> **Filename:** TAT.gif
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7026452245428440325?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1
> **Derivative of:** SCP-2744 by Jakdragonx
[[/<]]
-----
The color on this was so worth the three days of struggle they look so crisp and cool. I haven't really done pixel art where I've defined HIGHLIGHTS out of darkness rather than the other way around and it ended up being really really fun. I'm definitely gonna have to do that more, haha.

The timer definitely gave me anxiety and I felt like I was rushing through it the first time. I read it through like three times to make sure I was getting details properly and honestly? It was better the second time through. Which is usually a good sign! I found myself catching all the little hints and noticing things I didn't notice the first time through. It's safe to say I really liked it.

(Also I added two different versions of the gif, one with 2744 to make it easier for offsite people to find and one with the actual title for accuracy(Also also I had to cut out one of the list entries in the loop video audio because It wouldn't fit otherwise but that portion was so perfect to not use ð­))

[[/=]]
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="+SCP-6427 by Fishish" hide="[LAST ACTIVE: 560 MINUTES AGO.]"]]
[[image https://i.imgur.com/jfws2Xs.gif]]
++++ [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7028041310468705542?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Process Video] | [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7028041086249602309?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Loop Video] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:art-mycotherapy-6427-pix Artwork Page] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6427 SCP-6427]
[[<]]
> **Filename:** 6427loop.mp4, 6427.gif
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7028041086249602309?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1
> **Derivative of:** SCP-6427 by Fishish
[[/<]]
-----
The loop video I did for this one is my favorite so far I had some fun with it lmao. I got to get all dramatic because! Well, it was fitting. I had to get kinda creative with the anomaly because there wasn't a super great description of it(Which is not a fault of the article at all). I also got a little artistic license with the definition of a "fetal position" but I wanted the monster to be REALLY looming over Micheals.

I love this article. It's such a clever idea. I read it after the video log was removed and I actually went back and checked out the video log to check if there was a better description of the anomaly and I definitely agree that it does better without it. The simplicity with the strong payoff of the concept really really makes it

I honestly don't have anything else to say besides seriously go read it.
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="+SCP-6868 by Tstaffor, Rewrite of Cremo's article" hide="Oh my god it's 60% water"]]
[[image https://i.imgur.com/8ZAkl6c.gif]]
++++ [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7029528650768813317?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Process Video] | [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7029529096535297286?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Loop Video] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:art-mycotherapy-6868-pix Artwork Page] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6868 SCP-6868]
[[<]]
> **Filename:** 6868loop.mp4, 6868.gif
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7029529096535297286?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1
> **Derivative of:** SCP-6868 by Tstaffor(Rewrite of an article by Cremo)
[[/<]]
-----
For some reason I wanted to do a vaguely 70s bathroom scene I don't know why. I guess it just felt fitting for some reason? It's... probably something I arbitrarily decided based on the color scheme I picked out hahaha.

 Anyways I LOVE the kind of goofy fridge horror-type articles and this one definitely falls in that category. There's a backstory that's just implied yet despite never being told it, you can pretty easily read into it. A very quiet sort of upsettingness. Go read it!

Also Tstaffor, I was already in the planning phase for this one when you messaged me so I couldn't do the one you requested just yet ð­. I will try and ALSO do the one you requested eventually! It's on my list right now. I love getting requests from authors plugging their work!

(SCP-6868 is a re-write of an article by Cremo!)
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="+SCP-6502 by bigslothonmyface" hide="..."]]
[[image https://i.imgur.com/4lMmXAg.gif]]
++++ [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7032038149190651141?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Process Video] | [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7032039086781222150?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Loop Video] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:art-mycotherapy-6502-pix Artwork Page] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6502 SCP-6502]
[[<]]
> **Filename:** 6502loop.mp4, 6502.gif
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7032039086781222150?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1
> **Derivative of:** SCP-6502 by bigslothonmyface
[[/<]]
-----
For various reasons, this is probably gonna be the last one of these I do. At least for quite a while. But I think it turned out well anyway. It's a bit simpler than the other ones I've done but I think it's fitting. This is definitely an incredible article. Very emotionally impactful with no room for comfort.

I wanted the colors to reflect that. At first, I was going to have the background go deeper and deeper underground with the coffin at the bottom but it just didn't feel right. It just wasn't lonely enough.

That's the kind of vibe it needed to give off.
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="+SCP-999 by ProfSnider" hide="I was completely serious about wanting to eat it."]]
[[image https://i.imgur.com/dXrXOtj.gif]]
++++ [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7033812985550343430?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1 Process Video] | [https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7033615433722776838?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v11 Loop Video] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:art-mycotherapy-999-pix Artwork Page] | [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-999 SCP-999]
[[<]]
> **Filename:** 999loop.mp4, 999.gif
> **Author:** IronShears
> **License:** https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
> **Source Link:** https://www.tiktok.com/@ironshearss/video/7033615433722776838?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1
> **Derivative of:** SCP-999 by ProfSnider and SCP-682 by Dr Gears and Epic Phail Spy
[[/<]]
-----
Okay, I ended up not taking a break. Needed a distraction from bad health news. Either way, this turned out really cute! I think I drew 682 way cuter than 999 somehow but... I mean. It turned out adorable. The vibe reminds me of Kirby's pad from Kirby's epic yarn. Which is, I know, an extremely specific reference.

When I started these I said I was only gonna do more recent articles, and I'm still DEFINITELY gonna focus on more recent articles. But... I think I'm gonna throw in some classics just for flavor if people on TikTok ask for them. Gotta reward engagement or whatever.

Plus, when you do old ones they don't have a lot of stories so you don't have to //explain them//. Which means... I can just yell into a microphone about my //opinion// for the full minute. I'm pretty sure it's clear by now based on how much talking I do on my art pages that I LOVE to ramble about my opinion.

Normally more of a squishy, slimy invertebrate person but arthropods are fun too! Especially the ones that metamorphosis. Fun fact: moths and butterflies completely liquefy when in the chrysalis and the different parts of them grow separately before re-attaching to each other. //BUT/// they still retain memories from when they were caterpillars.

This probably just implies that at least part of the nervous system remains intact while the majority of the body turns to soup but... if you have an imagination it could mean something cooler probably. Moths are metal as hell. 

Another one where I interviewed the author! These have all been really fun to do, especially getting to draw the little characters but the last one was too long for TikTok, apparently, so I decided to do the regular process video for TikTok AND  Youtube video with the interview. You know I used to think I was afraid of cockroaches for YEARS. But what had ACTUALLY happened was that in middle school I read a very Christian fanfiction about l4d and one of the characters was scared of cockroaches and at that age, I still thought you could pick things you were scared of so I was like "I guess I'm scared of cockroaches now"

Then at one point someone asked me why I was scared of cockroaches and just replied that one time a bunch of them came running out of a box and over my feet in the garage. That had happened way before the fanfiction thing and didn't actually freak me out that much but I was way too embarrassed to say it was something I'd copied from a fucking left 4 dead fanfiction. So... when people asked I kept saying that

But because I kept saying that over and over again I FORGOT WHY I was doing it originally... but kept pretending to be afraid of cockroaches. This lasted until senior year when I re-discovered that fanfiction and went through all 5 stages of grief at once before eventually collapsing in on myself like a dying star and promising to never speak of this again. Like I'm doing right now. Sorry past me.

Anyways this article's really good. I like that the Agent and the D-Class are familiar with each other. I think it should be done more often. It really gives it some weight to it.

I also drew a lot of extra art for this one. 
These three! Funnily enough, I actually drew these ones first. And drew them in the backward order of when they first show up in the video?  I DO know how to credit THESE.

Needed to come up with my own 173 design but I wanted to preserve the ENERGY that everyone knows and not everyone loves. Was extremely close to just drawing one of those squeezy toys but I am pretty sure those are also not CC.

For 683... This is the second time I've drawn it and at this point, I refuse to ever do it justice. I have a huge soft spot for kids and an overwhelming disgust for anything that would put them in danger so 053's story has always been upsetting. I want her to be happy at the expense of the big dumb --beluga whale-- lizard.

I don't have any fun insightful commentary about 096. I'm gonna be honest I've never really had strong feelings about it.

I LOVE the way this one turned out. I had the idea to make the whole test chamber cake about halfway through and was like "Oh yeah." I know it's not actually in the article but there's no canon and the original article doesn't have anything in it implying this WOULDN'T be possible(Not to mention the fact that hyperrealistic cake videos are godless plains of existence where I've seen a wall turn out to be the cake) so technically there's no reason it COULDN'T have happened.

Also, I'm going back to my roots with this one.

The first time I ever did pixel art was when I tried to make a Minecraft texture pack where the whole world was cake. I had no idea what I was doing and got frustrated that dirt had the textured on ALL sides and gave up. Years later I revisited the idea once resource packs became a thing and I was able to get the dirt to look nice. But by that point, it was 1.13 and there were way too many blocks in the game. Maybe one day I'll finish it.

This article is very short and to the point and implies a lot without saying much. I like it! It's got a fun vibe that I haven't seen done a lot before. Whenever there's some undescribed threat I always end up drawing tentacles for some reason. They're just easy to draw and fun to animate.

I wanted to try something similar to the familiar black and white clinical-y graphics people use for a while now and the public interaction tone of this article seemed fitting for it! I asked on Twitter whether I should use dithering or not and people really liked the dithering it on a small scale but it did not turn out well in the final piece so I ended up not using it. You can kinda see me messing with it in the video. Thank you to everyone who offered their thoughts, though!

This is an older article but I love spec-bio a lot. It's not particularly impressive or long but it's a cute fun little thing. Sometimes that kinda stuff just catches my imagination better, I guess? Yeah. There's another spec-bio article I want to draw something for too eventually but I have been pretty busy getting ready for my hand surgery and had to pick one or the other.

Speaking of surgery, that's happening next Friday and I've got some stuff I need to get done before then so this is going to be the last one of these for a while, at least until after I've healed. I am gonna try and read out some of the articles I've drawn so far in full on youtube though, just to have SOMETHING to do while I'm healing.

Still, I hope I landed on a high note. I love drawing foliage and I kinda went all out for this one. I wanted to semi-accurately portray the species of trees listed(Japanese Red Pine and Silver-leaf Oak) and draw a cute little creature in there. That fox-like repto-mammal.

The very deserved SCP-7000! This article was intimidating me for a while cause of how long it is but it's really really good! I love the whole vibe, the characters, and the fact that the MAIN character is designed to be completely unlikable yet still manages to be endearing and make you care about him.

The anomaly is confusing the get a grasp on at first but as it goes on and on and on it makes more and more sense until suddenly, near the end, you understand perfectly. It's such a nice balance! It's a good article. I like it a lot :)

Also I put a LOT of trust into this article actually staying in the #1 spot so I wouldn't have to rush and get the video done the day after and I'm glad it worked out.
